fields.remark_A:
Thank you for submitting an extended abstract of your research to the Digital Transformation and Information Systems track at the Global Conference on Innovations in Management and Business (GCIMB). Based on independent assessments by the two Track Chairs and Associate Editor, it is a pleasure to accept your manuscript for inclusion at GCIMB 2021.

While we find your topic an exciting area to pursue and are sympathetic to your research, we would like to offer a few suggestions that may be useful as you continue working on this project. We would like to underscore that this work has high potential, and we look forward to reading the full paper.

1.	As you develop the paper further, we suggest that you focus on the motivation and literature review as this seems to be the section that would attract the most attention from readers and potential reviewers at journals.

2.	The paper would be strengthened by clearly outlining its specific contribution to the existing body of knowledge. One way to do this is to first present the theoretical gap that you wish to address in the motivation section. Then, there should be clear and well defined logical linkages between the motivation of the study to its research objectives. Consider explicitly providing the research questions that you are addressing in this study. Then provide linkages from its research question to its theory base and further to its research design, and from its research design to its contributions, and from its contributions back to its motivation.
3.	Please link the paper with recent research that examines issues related to information systems, and issues related to innovation, especially in the Indian context. It is important to join this emergent conversation in the literature as this would improve acceptability in high-ranked international journals. For example, papers related to India could answer the call for such research raised in CAIS by Karhade & Kathuria 2020. India related papers should cite recent top-tier publications that use India as a context for theory or data, such as Khuntia et al. JAIS 2021, Kathuria, et al. JMIS 2020, Khuntia et al. JMIS 2019, Kathuria et al. JMIS 2018. Similarly, as you could join the conversation around innovation and innovative uses of IT by citing papers such as Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021a, Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021b, Dong et. al JMIS 2021, and Saldanha et al. ISR 2021.

fields.remark_A: The paper analyses demand and supply risks according to a measure not specified by the authors.  The risks are only measured but the impacts of these risks on different performance measures of the supply chain are not studied. The topic therefore does not add anything novel to the literature.
fields.paper_title: The level of Demand and Supply Risks in Supply Chains of Manufacturing firms
Does Beauty Matter in Mutual Fund Performance?
Beyond Religious Tolerance

fields.remark_A: Even though the proposed research study has merit the abstract does not provide any insights into the conceptual model, theory, factors that would influence the decision to go abroad to study (pull and push factors), and details on how the data is going to be collected and analyzed. The paper is in the early stages, has potential but requires more development.
fields.paper_title: Factors Influencing Student╬ô├ç├ûs Migration to various countries:  A Survey and  Evaluation of  Majha Region╬ô├ç├ûs of Punjab

fields.remark_A:
This could be an interesting paper. It was not clear if the survey part of the study was done yet.
Would be interesting to hear about push factors such as economy, availability of education, availability of jobs.
University marketing strategists would be very interested in the results of this study
fields.paper_title: Innovations in Management and Business

fields.remark_A: Very good research study with a rigorous research methodology. The insights would be very useful to academics and practitioners. I strongly recommend the authors to submit the full paper for the proceedings.
fields.paper_title: Consumer forgiveness and Reconciliation: A study on the role of post-service failure employees╬ô├ç├û behaviour

fields.remark_A: Interesting research investigation using an experimental design methodology. The interaction effects are very interesting and the conclusions and applications would be very useful. I recommend you submit the paper for the proceedings.
fields.paper_title: Impact of service failure type and severity on consumer forgiveness: a study on interaction effect of relationship type

fields.remark_B: This promises to be an interesting abstract if the authors can sufficiently describe and justify how high performance work systems are operationalized.  This read to me like a "macro/organizational level variable."  If that is not the case, and you are indeed measuring it as a micro/individual level variable, please explain and justify that.  The same is true for the outcome variable - organizational success.  Please clarify how you are measuring that variable - micro level or macro level.  If it is a macro-level variable, will you be accounting for potential mediating/moderating variable?  All the best.
fields.paper_title: Impact of High performance work systems and Organizational citizenship behavior on Organizational Performance across Information technology employees

fields.remark_A: The paper involves analyzing the risks associated with supply and demand in the oil and gas industry. The topic seems to be studied in a good depth and therefore can be accepted for full paper
fields.paper_title: Risk in Oil and Gas Supply Chain

fields.remark_A: This is the same as abstract GCIMB210003.

fields.remark_A: The research topic about perceptions, attitudes of traditional medicine among rural and urban dwellers would be an interesting project. Even though the abstract did not provide any details on the methodology, results and conclusions, I am looking forward to the results.
fields.paper_title: Awareness, Attitude, And Utilization of Traditional Medicine Among People from Maharashtra And Gujarat

fields.remark_B: The abstract was prepared well and fits into the entrepreneurship and innovation track of the conference.  The abstract defined Green Banking well and the sample size of 319 people from Delhi is an appropriate size to support implications.
fields.institution: Rukmini Devi Institute of Advanced Studies
fields.paper_title: IMPACT OF GREEN BANKING CHANNEL ON CUSTOMER PERCEPTION

fields.remark_A: The study is interesting. There are a few suggestions to be incorporated while writing the full paper. The title of the research article has to be finetuned. The type of research design has to be mentioned and whether the reliability and validity of the data collection instrument is ensured by the researcher. The english grammar in the paper has to be improved.
fields.remark_B: This is an interesting abstract, however, I am not sure this is the right track for the paper. May be better submitted to a pedagogy/teaching focused track.

fields.remark_A: Interesting study on the use of web-based analytics to characterize product reviews in e-commerce websites. The abstract lacks details on the types of products that were reviewed and the results and conclusions from the study. I recommend the paper should be fully developed and submitted for the conference proceedings.
fields.paper_title: Analyzing Product reviews from E-commerce websites: Text analytics and Sentiment analysis approach.

fields.remark_A: A good concept (value-added shrimp) that requires a conceptual model development. The paper can contribute to the importance of the value-adding process, factors contributing to the model, and challenges and possible strategies for the industry to get access to global markets. I recommend submitting the full paper for the conference proceedings
fields.paper_title: The Valued-added shrimp-the way forward for the Indian Shrimp Industry to sustain competition in the global market-perspective review

fields.remark_A:
Development outcomes are very broad. 
Low Infant mortality rate, high Life expectancy etc. can be development outcomes. Financial inclusion and development go hand in hand. Before you take fertility rate as an indicator for financial inclusion and link it to development outcome, establish the relationship more specifically. If not there is a danger of establishing a high spurious correlation between these variables.

fields.remark_A:
It is an interesting idea to explore emotions during crises. We often think that people have to suppress all emotions in times of crisis. This study looks at whether emotions are suppressed or not. 
The study also explores how these emotions are responded to and changed to help the goal.
fields.paper_title: The role of emotion regulation for organizational resilience: a biographical analysis of an elite paratrooper unit in the second world war

fields.remark_B: Abstract needed more details on study design and impact of study.  The abstract did not provide as much elaboration as other abstracts recommended for approval.

Buying behaviour of Consumer in Pandemic Conditions

fields.remark_A:
This a very timely paper. Research is needed on current management theories and how they work in situations such as COVID 19. Often current managerial theories are singled out in studied to explore how they affect certain subsets of people. This paper takes the interesting perspective of looking at the situation and if the theories work or do we need a new theory. 

The benevolent approach perhaps is the way for a manager to treat employees in this crisis situation.

It would be nice to see in the presentation some hypotheses regarding the effect of the benevolent approach during COVID 19. Where will the data come from? What variables will be explored? How will these variables be measured? 

I look forward to hearing more about the benevolent approach and COVID 19, especially in terms of methodological issues.
fields.paper_title: ╬ô├ç┬úBenevolent Approach: The Theory ╬ô├ç├┐Z╬ô├ç├û of motivation probably pretermitted by Douglas McGregor╬ô├ç┬Ñ

fields.remark_A:
Thank you for submitting an extended abstract of your research to the Digital Transformation and Information Systems track at the Global Conference on Innovations in Management and Business (GCIMB). Based on independent assessments by the two Track Chairs and Associate Editor, it is a pleasure to accept your manuscript for inclusion at GCIMB 2021.

While we find your topic an exciting area to pursue and are sympathetic to your research, we would like to offer a few suggestions that may be useful as you continue working on this project. We would like to underscore that this work has high potential, and we look forward to reading the full paper.

1.	As you develop the paper further, we suggest that you focus on the literature review, theory development and empirics as this seems to be the section that would attract the most attention from readers and potential reviewers at journals.

2.	The paper would be strengthened by clearly outlining its specific contribution to the existing body of knowledge. One way to do this is to first present the theoretical gap that you wish to address in the motivation section. Then, there should be clear and well defined logical linkages between the motivation of the study to its research objectives. Consider explicitly providing the research questions that you are addressing in this study. Then provide linkages from its research question to its theory base and further to its research design, and from its research design to its contributions, and from its contributions back to its motivation.

3.	Please link the paper with recent research that examines issues related to information systems, and issues related to innovation, especially in the Indian context. It is important to join this emergent conversation in the literature as this would improve acceptability in high-ranked international journals. For example, papers related to India could answer the call for such research raised in CAIS by Karhade & Kathuria 2020. India related papers should cite recent top-tier publications that use India as a context for theory or data, such as Khuntia et al. JAIS 2021, Kathuria, et al. JMIS 2020, Khuntia et al. JMIS 2019, Kathuria et al. JMIS 2018. Similarly, as you could join the conversation around innovation and innovative uses of IT by citing papers such as Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021a, Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021b, Dong et. al JMIS 2021, and Saldanha et al. ISR 2021.

fields.remark_A: The dataset has been on UCI ML Repo since 2010, and there's already a number of papers that explore various machine learning methods to classify feta asphyxia in this dataset. fields.remark_A:
This is an interesting avenue of research. Adding emotionality to crisis research seems counterintuitive, so it is nice to see a study exploring the role of emotions in these situations. Of course, leaders would need to manage their emotions, and these studies give us a glimpse of how they do that in times of crisis.

It would be nice to see how this research works with other crises. This could lead to some interesting influencing variables to be explored.

It would be good to present the results for the aesthetic and embodied dimension in both the sense-making and sense giving of the participants

This paper should lead to a very lively discussion at the conference.
fields.paper_title: 1.	Investigating the embodied and aesthetic dimensions of crisis leadership: insights from a large-scale crisis simulation

fields.remark_B: Good manuscript that proposes the implications of the type of educational institution on the individual faculty members' work-life conflict and satisfaction. fields.remark_A:
Thank you for submitting an extended abstract of your research to the Digital Transformation and Information Systems track at the Global Conference on Innovations in Management and Business (GCIMB). Based on independent assessments by the two Track Chairs and Associate Editor, it is a pleasure to accept your manuscript for inclusion at GCIMB 2021.

While we find your topic an exciting area to pursue and are sympathetic to your research, we would like to offer a few suggestions that may be useful as you continue working on this project. We would like to underscore that this work has high potential, and we look forward to reading the full paper.

1.	As you develop the paper further, we suggest that you focus on the  literature review and theory development as these seem to be the sections that would attract the most attention from readers and potential reviewers at journals.

2.	The paper would be strengthened by clearly outlining its specific contribution to the existing body of knowledge. One way to do this is to first present the theoretical gap that you wish to address in the motivation section. Then, there should be clear and well defined logical linkages between the motivation of the study to its research objectives. Consider explicitly providing the research questions that you are addressing in this study. Then provide linkages from its research question to its theory base and further to its research design, and from its research design to its contributions, and from its contributions back to its motivation.

3.	Please link the paper with recent research that examines issues related to information systems, and issues related to innovation, especially in the Indian context. It is important to join this emergent conversation in the literature as this would improve acceptability in high-ranked international journals. For example, papers related to India could answer the call for such research raised in CAIS by Karhade & Kathuria 2020. India related papers should cite recent top-tier publications that use India as a context for theory or data, such as Khuntia et al. JAIS 2021, Kathuria, et al. JMIS 2020, Khuntia et al. JMIS 2019, Kathuria et al. JMIS 2018. Similarly, as you could join the conversation around innovation and innovative uses of IT by citing papers such as Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021a, Karhade & Dong MISQ 2021b, Dong et. al JMIS 2021, and Saldanha et al. ISR 2021.

fields.remark_A: A good research project indeed. You need to provide details about the theory that you applied to conduct the research. You should also provide what measures were used and the description of the sample used to collect the data. The study is descriptive research but not casual research. Causal research requires stringent criteria to qualify and your data collection and analytical method are not. I recommend you plan to submit the full paper to be considered for publication in the proceedings.

fields.remark_A: The abstract as written is a little vague about the criteria used to evaluate the investments. Is this a portfolio allocation question? What is the timeframe of investment considered? Do the authors use backtesting or in general how is information leakage across time periods handled? Also why is only one mutual fund considered? Why not more? There are thousands of ETFs. Otherwise seems like a useful piece of work. I'd be interested in hearing about the tradeoff between gold and cryptocurrencies, particularly for the younger crowd.

fields.remark_A: Very interesting study to determine the factors that predict or describe the online streaming subscription service. You identified  a set of factors in the introduction (price paid for the entertainment, options available, ongoing social trends, gender, location, and age) but you used other factors such as ease of usage, available media content, and cost of services. Any reason other factors were not considered. I am not sure what your dependent variable is? Is it one obtained the subscription to the app or not (1, 0) situation? If so did you use logistics regression? Or is it the choice of the subscription app? It is not very clear. You should develop your own weighing system and then compare it with the literature. High potential but at this stage, much work needs to be done. Hope the conference will provide an opportunity to refine your project.
